intro: Aldama coraniana, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, showy blooms during the spring and summer seasons. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
